titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of David Kiefer Theatre Collection at DC Public Library
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Derek Gray.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-05-05 09:41:05 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid revised to be more evergreen.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Series 1: Performance programs
The series contains performance programs and playbills from various Washington, D.C. theatres. Some are notable venues like the Source Theatre and Kennedy Center; others are small and less prominent.
Series 2: Theatre seasons
The series contains seasonal programs detailing a particular theatre's schedule of shows and highlighted performances.
Series 3: Printed material
This series contains theatre publications, newsletters, and clippings from Washington, D.C. newspapers on issues related to the theatre community. It is divided into four sub-series: 1. Publications, 2. Newsletters, 3. Clippings, and 4. Press releases.
Sub-series 1: Publications
This sub-series contains publications, such as magazines, by local theatres.
Sub-series 2: Newsletters
This sub-series contains newsletters published by local theatres.
Sub-series 3: Clippings
This sub-series contains clippings from D.C. newspapers on issues related to the theatre community.
Sub-series 4: Press releases
This sub-series contains press releases related to the theatre community.
Series 4: Miscellaneous
This series contains advertisement campaigns, jazz event advertisements, newsletters, performance flyers, publications, and theatre calendars, surveys, and questionnaires.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The theatre community has been a rich contributor to the cultural and social life of Washington, D.C. since the beginning of the city's history. This collection of theatre programs and other related materials belonged to David Kiefer, a local Washington, D.C.-area resident and avid theatre buff.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: David Kiefer donated this collection to the DC Public Library in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of newsletters, programs, publications, and other materials related to Washington, D.C. theatres.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.
